owl:Ontology.dc:title: Genomic Feature and Variation Ontology (GFVO)
owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Joachim Baran
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The Genomic Feature and Variation Ontology (GFVO) is modeled to represent genomic data using the Resource Description Format (RDF). It is captures the contents of data files that adhere to the Generic Feature Format Version 3 (GFF3, http://www.sequenceontology.org/resources/gff3.html), the General Transfer Format (GTF, http://mblab.wustl.edu/GTF22.html), the Genome Variation Format Version 1 (GVF, http://www.sequenceontology.org/resources/gvf.html), and the Variant Call Format (VCF, http://vcftools.sourceforge.net/specs.html). The creation of the ontology was inspired by previous work of Robert Hoehndorf on RDF2OWL (http://code.google.com/p/rdf2owl).
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment:
Best Practices
1.) The class hierarchy, object- and datatype-property hierarchies are modeled to match SIO's hierarchies.
2.) Every class and property has a label (rdfs:label) as well as a description (rdfs:comment). The description may contain an example of how a class/property is being applied.
3.) Classes that are directly related to either GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF specification have a link-out to the specification's document as provenance indicator (via rdfs:isDefinedBy).
4.) Link-outs to Wikipedia are provided for classes whereever possible.
5.) Ontology terms are encoded in the URIs using camel case, i.e. letters following a white space in an ontology term are capitalized followed by the removal of the white space.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: describes
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links to an entity for which supportive information is being provided.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has annotation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links to additional annotations about an entity.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has attribute
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links out to aggregate information for an entity.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has evidence
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: References an entity or resource that provides supporting evidence.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has first part
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the first entity of an ordered part relationship.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has identifier
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links out to an identifier.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has input
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links out to an entity that is the input of a "Process" subclass.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has last part
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the last entity of an ordered part relationship.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has member
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes membership for "Collection", "Catalog" and "File" instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has ordered part
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes a compositional relationship to other entities, where the ordering of the composition of entities carries meaning.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has output
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links out to an entity that is the output of a "Process" subclass.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has part
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes a compositional relationship to other entities.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has participant
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the participation of other entities in processes.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has quality
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links out to an entity that provides qualitative information.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has source
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes information origin.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is about
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: References an entity about which information is provided for.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is affected by
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes that an entity is affected by another entity.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is after
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the trailing occurrence or succession of the subject in regards to the object.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is attribute of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes that an entity is an attribute of the entity that this property links out to.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is before
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the leading occurrence or precedence of the subject in regards to the object.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is created by
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the process or method that created an entity.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is described by
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Provides a description of the subject via reference to an object that provides further information on the subject.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is located on
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the location of genomic feature on a landmark.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes that an entity is an intrinsic component of an encapsulating entity.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is participant in
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes participation with another entity.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is source of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes that an entity is the source of the entity that this property links out to.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is spatiotemporally related to
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes spatio-temporal relations to other entities.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is temporarily part of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment:
Denotes a temporarily constraint "isPartOf" relationship. The temporal restriction expresses that the relationship is not universally true.
This property can be used to express "Derives_from" relations in GFF3.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: references
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: References another entity or resource.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: refers to
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: References an entity, where additional information is provided to augment the reference.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has value
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Representation of any literal that is associated with a GFVO class instance. Domain restrictions might apply. For example, "Codon Sequence" entities restrict "has value" to be a non-empty string consisting of A, C, G, or T letters, and whose length is a multiple of 3.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Alias
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An alias is an alternative name whose use is mostly non-primary.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Allele Frequency
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Proportion of a particular gene allele in a gene pool.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Ancestral Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes an ancestral allele of a feature. May be used to denote the 'ancestral allele' of VCF formatted files.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Array Comparative Genomic Hybridization
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Feature provenance is based on array-comparative genomic hybridization.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Attribute
owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
An attribute denotes characteristics of an entity. At this stage, "Quality" is the only direct subclass of "Attribute", whose subclasses denote qualitative properties such as sex ("Female", "Male", "Mermaphrodite"), zygosity ("Hemizygous", "Heterozygous", "Homozygous"), etc.
The object property "hasQuality" (or subproperties thereof) should be utilized to express qualities of entities. The "hasAttribute" object property should be used to denote relationships to "Object" or "Process" instances, unless there is a better object property suitable to represent the relationship between the involved entities..

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Average Coverage
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Average coverage depth for a genomic locus (a region or single base pair), i.e. the average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Biological Entity
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A biological entity an entity that contains genomic material or utilizes genomic material during its existance. Genomic material itself is represented as sub-classes of Chemical Entity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Biopolymer Sequencing
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information about features and variants is based on biopolymer sequencing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Breakpoint
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A breakpoint describes the source or destination of a zero-length sequence alteration. These alterations are typically insertions, deletions or translocations according to the GVF specification (see "Breakpoint_detail" in http://sequenceontology.org/resources/gvf.html).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Catalog
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A catalog is a specialization of a "Collection", where all its contents are of the same type.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cell
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A cell is a biological unit that in itself forms a living organism or is part of a larger organism that is composed of many other cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Chemical Entity
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A chemical entity is an entity related to chemistry. This class is typically not instantiated, but instead, its subclasses "Amino Acid", "Chromosome", "Peptide Sequence", etc., are used to represent specific chemical entities.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Chromosome
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A chromosome is an abstract representation of an unnamed chromosome to represent ploidy within a data set. A "Chromosome" instance is used for for denoting the locus of phased genotypes. For placing genomic features ("Feature" class instances) on a chromosome, contig, scaffold, etc., please see the "Landmark" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Circular Helix
owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A circular helix structure.
Can be used to indicate a true "Is_circular" attribute in GFF3 and GVF.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Coding Frame Offset
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Coding frame offset of the feature, if it is a coding sequence or feature that contributes to transcription and translation. It is referred to as "frame" in GTF, but called "phase" in GFF3 and GVF. A feature's coding frame offset can be either 0, 1, or 2.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Codon Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A codon sequence is a nucleotide sequence underlying a potential amino acid sequence. Codon sequences are three bases of length or multiples thereof.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Collection
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A collection is a container for genomic data. A collection may contain information about genomic data including -- but not limited to -- contents of GFF3, GTF, GVF and VCF files. The latter are better represented by "File" class instances, whereas the result of unions or intersections between different "File" class instances should be captured within this format-independent "Collection" class. When importing data whose provenance is not a GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF file, instances of "Collection" should be utilized too, or the more restrictive "Catalog" class should be used.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Comment
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A comment is a remark about a piece of information, an observation or statement. In the context of GFF3, GVF, etc., genomic feature and variation descriptions, "isAfter" and "isBefore" relationships should be used to indicate where a comment is situated between pragma or feature statements of GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF files.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Contig
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A contig is a contiguous DNA sequence that has been assembled from shorter overlapping DNA segments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Coverage
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Number of nucleic acid sequence reads for a particular genomic locus (a region or single base pair).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA Microarray
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Feature information is based on DNA microarray probes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA Sequencing
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information about features and variants is based on DNA sequencing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Experimental Method
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An experimental method is a procedure that yields an experimental outcome (result). Experimental methods can be in vivo, in vitro or in silico procedures that are well described and can be referenced.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: External Reference
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A cross-reference to associate an entity to a representation in another database.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Feature
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The feature class captures information about genomic sequence features and variations. A genomic feature can be a large object, such as a chromosome or contig, down to single base-pair reference or variant alleles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Female
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denoting sex of a female individual. A female is defined as an individual producing ova.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: File
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A file represents the contents of a GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF file. It can capture genomic meta-data that is specific to any of these file formats. The result of unions, intersections or other operations between "File" class instances should be capture with the generic "Collection" class, which is format independent, or the more restrictive "Catalog" class should be used.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Forward Reference Sequence Frameshift
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a frameshift forward in the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Fragment Read Platform
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Details about the fragment-read (single-end read) sequencing technology used to gather the data in a set.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Functional Specification
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A functional specification of bioinformatics data, i.e. the specification of genomic material that potentially has biological function.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gametic Phase
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes the presence of information that required capturing the gametic phase. For diploid organisms, that means that information is available about which chromosome of a chromosome pair contributed data.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Genome
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Representation of a genome. Genomic features that constitute the genome may be linked via one or more "Collection", "Catalog", "Contig", "Scaffold" or "File" instances.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Genome Analysis
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A genome analysis denotes the type of procedure that was carried out to derive information from a genome assembly.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Genomic Ascertaining Method
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Provides information about the source of the data.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Genotype
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The genotype is the genetic information captured in a particular genome. It can also refer to one or more populations, if statistical distributions are provided that assign genetic codes to groups of individuals.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Germline Cell
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The germline feature class captures information about genomic sequence features arising from germline cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Helix Structure
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Helix structure denotes the physical shape of biopolymers.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Hemizygous
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alteration with hemizygous alleles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Heritage
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Heritage denotes the passing of traits from parents or ancestors. Passed traits may not be visible as a phenotype, but instead, might only manifest as genetic inheritance.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Hermaphrodite
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denoting sex of an individual that contains both male and female gametes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Heterozygous
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alteration with heterozygous alleles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Homozygous
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alteration with homozygous alleles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Identifier
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An identifier labels an entity with a single term that is interpreted as an accession. An accession labels entities that are part of a collection of similar type.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information Content Entity
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An information content entity requires background information or specific domain knowledge to be interpreted correctly.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Interaction
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describing interaction between features, such as the effect of a feature variant on another feature.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Label
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A label is a term or short list of terms that name an entity for the purpose of lexicographically distinguishing the entity from entities of similar type.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Landmark
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A landmark establishes a coordinate system for features. Landmarks can be chromosomes, contigs, scaffolds or other constructs that can harbor "Feature" class instances. For expressing ploidy within a data set, please refer to the "Chromosome" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Locus
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A locus refers to a position (possibly multi-dimensional) within a genome or proteome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Male
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denoting sex of a male individual. A male is defined as an individual producing spermatozoa.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Match
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a match between the reference sequence and target sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material Entity
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A material entity represents a physical object. In the context of genomic features and variations, material entities are cells, organisms, sequences, chromosomes, etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Maternal Heritage
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Maternal heritage is the passing of traits from a female to her ancestors.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Mobile Element Sequence Variant
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Insertion or deletion of a mobile element. The exact modification is determined by a type of the Variation Ontology.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Name
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A name assigns an entity a non-formal term (or multiples thereof) that can provide information about the entities identity.
A note is a short textual description.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Number of Reads
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Number of reads supporting a particular feature or variant.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Object
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An object is a concrete entity that realizes a concept and encapsulates data associated with said concept. Objects are typically representing tangible entities, such as "Chromosome", "DNA Sequence", but also objects such as "Identifier", "Average Coverage" or other computational or mathematical entities.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Paired End Read Platform
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Details about the paired-end read sequencing technology used to gather the data in a set.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Paternal Heritage
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Paternal heritage is the passing of traits from a male to his ancestors.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Peptide Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A peptide sequence is an ordered sequence of amino acid residues, but which may not necessarily be a protein sequence. For encoding sequences of proteins, the subclass "Protein Sequence" should be used.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Phenotype
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A phenotype description represents additional information about a sequenced individual's phenotype. A sequenced individual is represented by instances of the "Sequenced Individual" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Phred Score
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Phred score can be used to assign quality scores to base calls of DNA sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Prenatal Cell
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A prenatal feature is purportedly associated with prenatal cells; the GVF specification declares this feature type under the prama directive "##genomic-source", but does not describe its semantics and the referenced Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC, http://loinc.org), do not define the meaning or intended usage of the term "prenatal" either.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Process
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A process denotes a temporally dependent entity. It can be thought of as a function, where input data is transformed by an algorithm to produce certain output data.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Protein Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A protein sequence is a peptide sequence which represents the primary structure of a protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Quality
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Quality is a specific attribute that is strongly associated with an entity, but whose values are varying and disjunct. Qualities are finite enumerations, such as sex ("Female", "Male", "Hermaphrodite"), heritage ("Maternal", "Paternal"), but they also make use of the "hasValue" datatype property such as "Coding Frame Offset" (either "0", "1" or "2").

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Quantity
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A property of a phenomenon, body, or substance, where the property has a magnitude that can be expressed by means of a number and a reference. This class is typically not directly instantiated, but instead, its subclasses "Allele Frequency", "Average Coverage", etc. are used.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA Sequencing
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information about features and variants is based on RNA sequencing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reference Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes the reference sequence of a feature. The reference sequence is of importance when dealing with genomic variation data, which is expressed by the "Variant" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reference Sequence Gap
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a gap in the reference sequence for an alignment.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reverse Reference Sequence Frameshift
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a frameshift backwards (reverse) in the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Scaffold
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A scaffold is the aggregation of multiple contigs to form a larger continuous sequencing region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Score
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A measure that permits the ranking of entities.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence provides information about any biopolymer sequences. Specialized subclasses are provided to denote specialized instances of sequences, such as "Codon Sequence", "Reference Sequence", "Protein Sequence", etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequence Alignment
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alignment denotes the congruence of two sequences. In GFF3, a sequence alignment can be a nucleotide-to-nucleotide or protein-to-nucleotide alignment (see "The Gap Attribute", http://sequenceontology.org/resources/gff3.html). "Alignment Operation" class instances denote the actual steps that the constitute the sequence alignment.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequence Alignment Operation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alignment operation captures the type of alignment (see "Sequence Alignment") between a reference sequence and target sequence. Note that an "Alignment Operation" is situated in a linked list, where the order of the alignment operations is of significance.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequence Variant
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describing specific sequence alterations of a genomic feature. A variant is related to "Reference" class instances, which denote the sequence that serves as a basis for sequence alteration comparisons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequenced Individual
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Aggregated sequencing information for a particular individual.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequencing Technology Platform
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Details about the sequencing/microarray technology used to gather the data in a set.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sex
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Biological sex of an individual.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Somatic Cell
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The somatic feature class captures information about genomic sequence features arising from somatic cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Span
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A span is an attribute denoting the number of nucleotides or peptides that an entity covers. This is directly used in conjunction with "Sequence Alignment Operation" subclasses, e.g. to express the number of nucleotides a sequence alignment match ranges over.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Target Sequence Gap
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a gap in the target sequence for an alignment.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Total Number of Reads
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Total number of reads covering a feature or variant.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Variant Calling
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes the technique of calling genomic feature variants in a genome assembly.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Version
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A version names a release of a software, dataset, or other resource. A versioned resource is not necessarily public.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Watson-Crick Helix
owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Helical structure as first proposed by Watson and Crick.
Can be used to indicate a false "Is_circular" attribute in GFF3 and GVF.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Zygosity
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Zygosity denotes the similarities of a specific allele in the genome of an organism.
